questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: I can swallow 500 lbs (230 kg) in one bite
I am one of the most formidable predators the earth has known
My arms were smaller than his head

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: My long tail allowed me to defend myself in case of attack
I am among the biggest herbivores
I can eat up to 1 ton of plant per day

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: I had four swim paddles, a rare, if not unique, feature in marine animals
I had a small head and a long neck
I served as the basis for the legend of the Loch Ness monster

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: the longest known theropod, measuring 16 to 18 meters and up to 5 to 6 meters high
I could be a land predator or a fisherman as shown by my long jaws
I had a back veil

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: I was a large vegetarian dinosaur who lived at the end of the Cretaceous
My bone beak was devoid of teeth
My name means "head with three horns"

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: My hind limbs were provided with a retractable claw of approximately 15 centimeters, capable of being positioned almost vertically to shred the skin of its prey.
I had an excellent running speed of up to 60 km / h
the volume of my brain is relatively large in proportion to my size

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: I am considered to be the largest species of snake (fossil and current) identified so far
I could reach up to 12.8 meters long for 2,000 kg
I killed my prey by hugging them in my rings and could crush my prey with my jaws

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: My name comes from ancient Greek meaning "big tooth"
Whales were my main source of food
My teeth were thick and strong, designed to grab prey and break bones

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: I lived mainly in South America, then conquered the entire American continent
I am easily recognisable by my teeth
In the comic called "Rahan" we find me under the name of Gorak

questions.author: Charlier Guillaume
clues: My disappearance, which occurred in modern times, is directly attributable to human activity
I am a close relative of modern pigeons
I can't fly
